description: From Middle English wofully, equivalent to woeful +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: woefully (comparative more woefully, superlative most woefully)

entries.meaning: In a woeful manner; to an unfortunately great extent.
examples: In a convulsion that has caught many in Brazil and beyond by surprise, waves of protesters denounced their leaders for dedicating so many resources to cultivating Brazil’s global image by building stadiums for international events, when basic services like education and health care remain woefully inadequate.
